intro: Echites cordatus, commonly known as the heartleaf lantana, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as swamps and wetlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
